edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Class AbstractWordAlignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.AbstractWordAlignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WordAlignment
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GIZAWordAlignment, SymmetricalWordAlignment

    public class AbstractWordAlignment
extends Object
implements WordAlignment
    Abstract class representing a set of word alignments for one sentence pair. It defines both source-to-target and target-to-source word aligments, which are not necessarily symmetrical (since words aligners such as GIZA do not produce symmetrical word alignments).
    Author:
    Michel Galley
    See Also:
    GIZAWordAlignment, SymmetricalWordAlignment

      • preproc

        public static String[] preproc(String[] words)
        Any training data pre-processing can be applied here. Note that this pre-processing can't change the number of tokens. Probably not the right place for language specific stuff.
        Parameters:
        words - input sentence
        Returns:
        output sentence

      • removeBadTokens

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        output sentence

      • init

        public void init(int[][] matrix)
        Initialize alignment using a matrix in LDC format (such as the ones used in parallel treebanks. Convention: 1-indexed words, and index zero reseved for unaligned words.
        Parameters:
        matrix - alignment matrix
